unnormalised: ## Flash Sales: Blink and You Miss It, Like Finding a Parking Spot in Chandni Chowk!
normalised: ## Flash Sales: Blink and You Miss It, Like Finding a Parking Spot in Chandni Chowk!

unnormalised: Ah, flash sales. They're the digital equivalent of your aunty barging into a wedding buffet, yelling "Jaldi karo, rasgulla khatam ho jayega!" (Hurry up, the rasgullas will run out!). They promise rock-bottom prices, enough to make even a Chanakya-level negotiator like my Uncle Ramesh blush.
normalised: Ah, flash sales. They're the digital equivalent of your aunty barging into a wedding buffet, yelling "Jaldi karo, rasgulla khatam ho jayega!" (Hurry up, the rasgullas will run out!). They promise rock-bottom prices, enough to make even a Chanakya-level negotiator like my Uncle Ramesh blush.

unnormalised: Retailers, both big and small (like Sharma Ji’s Kirana store now online), are using flash sales to clear inventory faster than a Mumbai local during peak hours. One minute that gorgeous Anarkali suit from Lajpat Nagar is Rs. 5000, the next minute it's a steal at Rs. 2000! You gotta be quicker than Rajinikanth catching a bullet.
normalised: Retailers, both big and small (like Sharma Ji’s Kirana store now online), are using flash sales to clear inventory faster than a Mumbai local during peak hours. One minute that gorgeous Anarkali suit from Lajpat Nagar is rupee five thousand, the next minute it's a steal at rupee two thousand! You gotta be quicker than Rajinikanth catching a bullet.

unnormalised: But here’s the thing: are they always worth the frenzy? Sometimes it feels like you’re fighting off hungry wolves for a slightly-less-ugly sweater. Other times, you genuinely score a diamond in the rough, like that time I got a 40-inch smart TV for 60% off! (My neighbors in Andheri are still jealous).

unnormalised: The trick is knowing your stuff. Read the fine print faster than Dr. Iyer’s handwriting on a prescription. Check the return policy (because, let's be honest, that "perfectly fitting" shirt might resemble a potato sack once you try it on). And remember, compare prices! Just because it's a "flash sale" doesn't mean it's always the cheapest.

unnormalised: Last month, I almost bought a rug advertised as "hand-woven Himalayan wonder" at 80% off. Turned out it was made in a factory in Bhiwandi and probably covered a measly 50 sq ft. Thankfully, a quick Google search saved me from embarrassing myself at the next Diwali party.

unnormalised: So, should you dive into the flash sale frenzy? Maybe. But remember, shopping smart is more important than shopping fast. Otherwise, you might end up with more regrets than a Bollywood director after a flop movie. And that, my friends, is a story for another day! Happy shopping!
